Build Games Module¶

This module defines factory functions and utilities used to construct structured 2x2 games.

llmgt.data.build_games.cond_p1_dominant_bot(x1, x2, x3, x4)[source]¶

Returns True if Player 1 strictly prefers the bottom row.

Requires: x3 > x1 and x4 > x2

llmgt.data.build_games.cond_p1_dominant_top(x1, x2, x3, x4)[source]¶

Returns True if Player 1 strictly prefers the top row.

Requires: x1 > x3 and x2 > x4

llmgt.data.build_games.cond_p2_dominant_left(y1, y2, y3, y4)[source]¶

Returns True if Player 2 strictly prefers the left column.

Requires: y1 > y2 and y3 > y4

llmgt.data.build_games.cond_p2_dominant_right(y1, y2, y3, y4)[source]¶

Returns True if Player 2 strictly prefers the right column.

Requires: y2 > y1 and y4 > y3

llmgt.data.build_games.sample_fn(condition: Callable[[int, int, int, int], bool])[source]¶

Samples payoff tuples until a given condition is satisfied.

Parameters:

condition (Callable) – A function that takes four integers (payoffs) and returns True if the sampled tuple meets the criteria.

Returns:

A payoff tuple that satisfies the condition.

Return type:

tuple[int, int, int, int]

llmgt.data.build_games.sample_game_fn(p1_cond: Callable[[int, int, int, int], bool], p2_cond: Callable[[int, int, int, int], bool])[source]¶

Samples a payoff tuple for each player, satisfying their respective conditions.

Parameters:

  • p1_cond – Condition applied to Player 1’s payoff tuple.

  • p2_cond – Condition applied to Player 2’s payoff tuple.

Returns:

(p1, p2).

Return type:

A pair of payoff tuples

llmgt.data.build_games.sample_payoffs() → list[int][source]¶

Samples a list of four random payoff values between 1 and 10.

Returns:

A list of four integers representing 2x2 game payoffs.

Return type:

list[int]
